column5: Weather was bad to begin with but got nicer.  The bass were on and where they were supposed to be.  They were all feeding pretty hard with loads of semi-digested crayfish flying all over the place.  I lost 3 bass that weighed over 4 pounds each. One broke the line and the other 2 spat it on a jump. I did manage to land a 3 pounder, several 2 pounders and countless 14 inchers. Drop shotting worked best by far.  Probably caught 25 bass and lost almost as many.  Need sharper hooks.
have to learn how to add more than one pic at a time.  I guess they are too many k.
Sounds like the bass opener was a success!! Nice bass! Thanks for sharing!
Way to go out there!  Congrats on a good day on the water.  Many people didn't bother going out because of the rain in the forecast...good on you for getting out there.
Nice size Bass! What type and pound test were you using?
Beauty smalljaws, congrats and thanks for the report.  Cheers, 1leg
Awe Simcoe bass and back ground shots.LOL Just playing with ya Cudz. Nice fish. If yer looking for a partner for a mornings fish,give a yelp.
